Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home ...and they take pets !”
Reviews.Author: Bernice L
Reviews.Content: Booked the 2 bedroom suite. Beds were both King size! Their bedding was very comfortable, providing a good nights sleep. This type of set up is great for large families,couples, or a girls weekend away. Very private and homey. Large hot/cold breakfast in the morning all a part of the cost. Very close to the airport and other venues. Rates from Thursday to Sunday are very reasonable, but go up significantly during the week...I found that odd. Stayed at other Residence Inns, Minneapolis and Atlanta, and also found them a great place to stay. The best part is the fact they are Pet friendly. Yes, there is a fee but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: RedCyren
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now, both times (June 2011 and March 2012) with my family of four. Both times we stayed in a 2 queen bed suite that had a living area, full kitchen, two separate bedrooms and each bedroom had its own bathroom - all for significantly less than other Toronto airport hotels. This type of suite had a gas fireplace. Each room had a tv, approx 24", so three TVs in total. They also had a full kitchen with a stove, microwave, fridge (with ice maker), dishwasher, toaster and coffee maker, and the kitchen was suited with dinnerware, cutlery, can openers, measuring cups, cutting board and linen. A small four seat dining table accompanied the kitchen area. The living area had a long chaise/loveseat that could be used as a pull-out with linen in the suite. The beds were firm but comfortable with your choice of five pillows in each bed - 3 feather, 2 foam (and comfy!). To add to the suite, the hotel provides complimentary toiletries, which is handy when you're missing a toothbrush or razor in the wee hours of the morning before or after a flight. The hotel also offers a grocery shopping service for a VERY small fee, and they will have your items in the suite later in the afternoon. The complimentary breakfast is quite decent. Hot food included scrambled eggs, sausages, french toast, potato hash, and waffles. An assortment of cereals and other pastries are available along with all sorts of condiments (jellies, peanut butter, cream cheese, etc.) The breakfast can also be taken to go up to your room if you choose. Quite enjoyable! Never been to the onsite pool yet or attended any of the weeknight social activities they have in their main lounge and dining area during the week. For the price of the room for three to five people, we found this to be an absolutely wonderful stay when coming to and from the airport. It's mere minutes by car to the airport and they also participate in the Park n' Fly programs. The only drawback that I found - make sure you're up to get breakfast before 8:30 a.m. otherwise the dining room is full of parents and kids. Not my personal cup of tea but each to their own!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Accomodation at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: tidsbur
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite over the phone, the clerk was pleasant to deal with and gave me what I thought was a very reasonable rate. Was somewhat dubious of what I would be getting for such a rate but she assured me I would be happy. I definitely was, although it is not a new hotel, the suite was furnished nicely, well kept and spottlessly clean. The reasonable rate also included a hot breakfast for 4 in their lounge. Food was good, including, scrambled eggs, sausages, hash browns, cereal, breads/bagels, fruit and fresh waffles. They were only too happy to allow us to have a late check out as our flight was later in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Warm Atmosphere...but the turkey bacon has got to go!”
Reviews.Author: Jesusmoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights while working in Toronto. Ambience works to make it seem more than just a hotel room for extended stay(which I think is the whole idea behind this concept!) We had a two bedroom suite with a living room and kitchen area. Really liked the working fireplace (gas)in the living room. Nice to sit and have a drink after a day at work. Each bedroom was self-contained with its own bathroom and tv so you could get away from your co-worker if desired. Kitchen was fully equipped but we rarely used it except for the fridge and micro wave. We left a list of grocery items with the front desk and it appeared the same day. The cost of items appeared on room bill. There was no extra charge for shopping. The free breakfast at first seemed great! But as the days wore on seemed repetitive and industrial. NO ONE, I REPEAT, NO ONE ate the turkey bacon. This stuff was GOD AWFUL! As I sat and watched a busy breakfast room for 8 days people stayed away from the turkey bacon. Oh my kingdom for real bacon......One day I was all excited, looked like a version of eggs florentine,,,,I even had it out of the chaffing dish, practically on my plate...and then I saw it , hiding under the eggs and spinache...turkey bacon! I think the breakfast staff even realized it was a hard sell so they tried to trick us into eating it...SHAME! Another positive note was the free shuttle to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Where are the mirrors?”
Reviews.Author: AquariusShark
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel very last minute in new years eve when we had mire house guests than expected. My partner and I opted to sleep here for the night after a priceline deal. We checked in late after New Years Eve celebrations and Mercedes at the Frobt Desk was friendly and very genuine in her approach. She was definately a highlight. The rooms decor was fine... Just not to my taste, a bit old fashioned. It was very clean! The original room we were assigned had an alarm if some kind going off inside a locked closet, but this was quickly remedied with a call to the Front Desk and a new room. My main fault with this hotel is how the room was laid out. I had to go to work early thenext day whereas my partner did not. The sink and ONLY mirror in the entire room us right off the bedroom with no separation between it and the bed. Not wanting to wake my partner by turning on the light, I was forced to shave and get ready for work without a mirror. Once at work I checked to make sure my tie was on straight and that my hair didn't have a cowlick! Other than a sock on the floor outside the elevators as I was leaving and the police officers posted in the lobby (I'm sure as a precaution for new years and not a mainstay) this hotel was fine. But if management reads this... Put a mirror somewhere else in the room or separate the bedroom from the sink portion of the washroom with a door!

Reviews.Title: “Swingers and Sleezes”
Reviews.Author: Wantcleansheets
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a complete floor reserved for Swingers that go the the XClub nearby. Don't take the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S P
Reviews.Content: I don't think I could find a single negative thing to say about this property. The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming, the rooms were large and clean (love having a full kitchen in my room!), the beds and pull-out sofa were very comfy, the free breakfast was good (and the staff were really friendly and helpful), and the hotel was conveniently located (close to highways and right next to the airport). I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My best airport hotel stay at YYZ”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: We were on the way home from Europe and arrived at Pearson airport on New Year's Eve. Instead of pushing on with connecting flights, we looked for a place that could comfortably accommodate our group of five adults. A two bedroom, two bathroom suite, with sofa bed did the trick nicely. From the shuttle bus transfer to check-in to breakfast the next morning, everything went well. The hotel has excellent staff, is very clean and was utterly quiet and comfortable. We ordered a pizza and drank duty-free champagne using the cutlery and glasses provided. Breakfast on New Year's day was pleasant enough, and the shuttle ride back to YYZ was equally comfortable. Compared to the older hotels that are closer to YYZ, this Residence Inn wins out on value, comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: MickeyCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on arriving in Toronto. We were lucky, the shuttle was waiting at the door when we came out of Terminal 1. The same shuttle took us back the next morning to pick up our rental car. Breakfast is a little chaotic with lots of children but the staff recognised that this and opened up a quieter place to sit and eat - much appreciated. The rooms were nice, clean and tidy. The presence of a functioning kitchen (no oven) meant we could make a dinner on the second evening. The hotel provided a map of the area with grocery stores etc marked.

Reviews.Title: “Hockey friendly”
Reviews.Author: TowelboyOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed during our hockey tournament. The staff was very courteous and considerate of our needs as a large group with kids. The large suites rooms were a huge bonus for families too. The value per family was better than most regular hotels. We will do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Imagined!”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Eleanor_Knight
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the Residence Inn Toronto Airport to be not much different from the Residence Inn Linda, Pete, Pat and I stayed at in Mississauga last year, but I was amazed at how well-kept the rooms were! The location on the #58 Malton bus line was an added bonus, as I could use it to go downtown. This time, Pat stayed home in Indianapolis to tend to the pets, so it was just Linda and Pete accompanying me on this trip to Canada. On our first night, we were astonished that we were getting a complimentary dinner as well as the standard continental breakfasts. So we put away the take-out dinner we ordered from Swiss Chalet in London and, instead, settled down to a dinner of pierogies, three-bean salad, regular salad, some fiery coleslaw, and two kinds of pie. During our stay, Linda had to have prosthetic breast cancer surgery, which was done by visiting practitioner Irene Healy, who maintained offices in Rochester, NY as well as Toronto. Linda also conducted a breast cancer support group meeting at our hotel room on the third evening of our stay in Toronto. Linda even befriended the RI's housekeeping staff, which is a great sign. The only hangup was that the indoor pool was not heated; and Linda, Pete and I could not swim very long. The hot tub more than made up for it, however. I managed to take in a Toronto Argonauts game as well as visit Eaton Centre and the Royal Ontario Museum plus ride the subway. I did, however, have to remind Pete about the Gardiner Expressway being closed for maintenance, as I had been listening to traffic reports on 680 AM. The fitness room was like the one at Mississauga, with free weights, treadmills and Nordic Track-type machines plus a TV to watch if you like and a water cooler. I used the fitness room twice during my stay. The continental breakfasts that were served at Toronto Airport were usually the same--sausages with scrambled eggs and home-style potatoes; four types of cereal (thankfully, none of them pre-sweetened); muffins; waffles, which you made yourself; Dannon's Silhouette yogurt (the brand marketed in Canada); skim or 2% milk; and four types of fruit juice. The first morning I ate breakfast, I had to leave the crowded dining room ASAP, because there was a police convention. On the morning of check-out, there was no fresh fruit--neither apples, bananas or even oranges. The front desk staff was very helpful with everything I would want to know about Toronto. They even exchanged my American currency so I wouldn't have to do it at the local bank, where I would be given unfavorable rates. I even got to use the Internet terminals located on the first floor to track down my G-Mail, which was helpful in communicating with family back in Indiana. Apart from some minor inconveniences such as the ones mentioned, I had a very enjoyable stay and had some pleasant nights of sleeping, though on one evening (after I went to the game), I was so overwhelmed with excitement that I couldn't sleep. I don't blame that on the hotel. The fireplace and the painting added a nice touch to the hotel room. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “After staying here.... I will never pay the high prices right beside the airport (YYZ)”
Reviews.Author: Lambie06
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. Absolutely spotless and lovely rooms. We usually stay directly outside of the the Toronto Airport (YYZ) the night prior to a long flight but felt that the prices were getting ridiculous. After researching the area, we found the Marriott Residence which is really only a few extra streets over from the Airport strip. We were able to get a 2 bedroom suite with living room and small kitchen (2 couples) for the price of one room on the strip. Great beds and sheets. The staff were great and you are also able to park your car on their premises while away. The have a shuttle to the airport and a nice area for breakfast (however we have not yet eaten there as our flights are generally quite early)

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent and idiotic management”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroNorte
Reviews.Content: HAD stayed at this hotel multiple times in the past, always pleasant stays in the past, will never return. As per previous reviews, management of this hotel has grown indifferent, cheap, and lazy. A myriad of small unpleast issues could have been shrugged off but not the final insult. First, an unpublished and unadvertised $8 per night charge to park in their badly lit unsupervised lot. I can understand charging for parking at a prime location, or for extended use of the lot if you are flying out, but this was just a straight up 'extra cash' grab. Second, the staff paid NO attention to detail. The rooms were cleaned, but if you expected food at breakfast, good luck. The hotel was busy and massively understaffed so that the small vessels at the breakfast buffet emptied rapidly and took forever to get refilled. 3 out of 4 morhings I had to wait around to get coffee, wait around for the juice to be refilled, wait for more bread, etc.... A 15 minute breakfast dragged into an hour waiting for food to be brought out. ONE poor server trying to take care of the entire dining area; it wasn't her fault, but trying to cater to the number of guests they had with 1/3 of the required staff is a clear sign of bad, cheap management. The pool never had towels. I mean never. We would ask at the desk, be told 'someone is coming', and a full hour later, still no towels. My teenager asked for the code to get on to their lobby PC's. They were told condescendingly that the terminals are "not for children to use". Nice attitude, great customer service for a 'family' hotel. The last straw was an issue with our furniture. The night of our last stay we picked up the coffee table to move it away from the fold out sofa bed so our son could go to bed. One corner of the table top came away in my hand. The table top was a heavy marble and the table top separated right along the vein of the marble. All of this was explained to the hotel, but they still charged my credit card for 'breaking' the furniture. Speaking to me and scolding me like a small child for this was icing on the cake. I am going to fight the charges, but this is a sad case of a once pleasant and comfortable hotel with decent and caring staff going right down the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2011 for several nights. The poor experience I had with this hotel probably might not happen to most who visit. But it is an indication of the quality of a hotel how they react should something does go wrong. During the night the sprinker system in my room began to leak, causing the carpet to become wet in the living area. I advised reception in the morning and then went to work. Upon arriving back that evening I went into my room and noticed that the floor was still wet. They had not bothered to ensure that the carpet was dry, and with the room enclosed the room smelt terrible. I'll also add that I began to feel ill during the day and had developed a cough. All indications it was the room that was the cause of this. I advised reception and they put me into another room. Then another issue happened. With my suitcase in the room, my laptop on, I left the room. I could not get back in. The electronic lock didn't unlock. Another key and master key could not open the door, the electronic lock had failed. Now they could have called a locksmith straight away. But instead they decided to save a few bucks. I had to wait several hours for the manager to drive to the hotel. He had to drive to another hotel to pick up a metal bar that slid under the door to open it from the other side. This exercise itself took about 30 minutes. Now they did offer another room in the interim, but what good was that when all my belongings were locked in a room I couldn't get into any I had a long overseas trip the following day. I can forgive the leaking sprinkler, even the failed lock. But I can't forgive the wet smelly room, managements decision not to call a locksmith straight away, and that they didn't have appropriate equipment onsite to handle the situation. Not happy.

Reviews.Title: “clean and predictable”
Reviews.Author: Sevenfortyfive
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Room was clean. Lots of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: FairValueExpected
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here several times for up to a 1 week period. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Having a full fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, pots and pansâ€¦ is a great for extended stays especially since the room also includes a dishwasher. The hot breakfast is very good and on many evenings a light dinner is also included in the room price. Donâ€™t feel like cooking or taking in the free meals. No problem, lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. Shuttle service to the airport is also included and a bus that will get you downtown is only a couple of blocks away. Iâ€™ll continue to stay here whenever I can as I find it better, because of the size of the rooms and the additional included features, than the other hotels in the area (Crown Plaza & Sandman Signature Hotel). Separate bedroom with a door that closes and keeps out the sound, a fold out couch in the living room for an extra guest, TV in both the bedroom and the living room, not much more that I can say. I just like this place because itâ€™s comfortable, quite, spacious, and great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice nothing so special”
Reviews.Author: HFE H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days . Firstly there is nothing around the hotel . Only few restaurants and nothing more to spend tiime. The closest shopping area is 10 minutes with taxi but you have to pay 25 dollars . The hotel room was nice especially for families with its kitchen equipment Bed is comfortable but when it comes to bathroom amenities and cleaniliness its lower then marriott standars. Especially there was a towel thorn from sides and I warned the front desk they said ohhh how can it happen but the other day it was still there . And after breakfast I warned front desk personally but until my stay finished the thorned towel was still there . Shortly It is a standard family hotel with no great luxury and with an avarage breakfast.And in the middle of nowhere . At the beginning it seems cheaper according to downtown hotels but iÅŸf you want to buy somthing or entertain you should pay a lot of taxi fares .

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LorieCalgary
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in a one bedroom suite , room are very clean and beds are very comfortable, They even will grocery shop for you for free if you submit your order to the front desk by 10 am. Staff were great and very accommodating. Very good value for price paid

Reviews.Title: “A top class Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavender25_22
Reviews.Content: A top class Marriott hotel with added benefits of all other Residence Inn hotel like Buffet breakfast, evening social and friendly staff. The lobby and the whole hotel ambience and decor were much better compared to some other Residence Inns we have stayed. Residence Inn is like a second home to us now having stayed for almost 14 months at different locations. There is an airport shuttle every 30 minutes. So if you need to go downtown and donâ€™t have a car, take the shuttle and go to the airport. Then take the 192 TTC to Kipling and then take subway to downtown. This is also a good means if your office is in downtown. There is an extra charge for parking. There is also a basketball court in front of the hotel. I think there are laundry facilities in each floor which is an added convenience. The charges for $1.75 each for washing and drying.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great expreience!”
Reviews.Author: catet2
Reviews.Content: Anne the FOA was very nice and professional...check in was fast and very efficient.Hotel surrounding were beautiful, my children enjoyed playing badminton and basketball at their courtyard. They also enjoyed the warm swimming pool. Fitness room was great, hotel lobby and hallways were very clean. Our room was spacious, clean but not clean enough. I made sure that they provide us a very clean, and a hypoallergenic room (the hotel was pet friendly) I don't mind a pet friendly hotel bec we've been to so many pet friendly hotels in a year and we had no reactions from it. But...in this hotel...my kids we're all sneezing and nose running for our two nights stay. I even asked the housekeeping to send us extra kleenex boxes bec they've run out. Which were also nice from the hotel staff they send us extra boxes right away. Behind the night table beside the kingsize bed was a disaster...very dirty and dusty (housekeeping should clean also even behind the furnitures and not only the exposed ones) There was a towel stuck at the a/c vent of the bedroom what on earth was it doing there? Anyways aside from these few mentioned points.....overall was an excellent stay. Breakfast was outstanding! On our first morning they served scrambled eggs, sausages, potatoes, pork and beans, waffles, fruits, etc etc etc. On the second morning was a different menu....totally love love love the hearty breakfast. We all enjoy the food! We will deffinitely come back again.....but please when I request for a hypoallergenic and a clean room please make sure it is really a speaking span clean!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: nadsmada
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff all of them. I have no complaints. The place was clean and very quiet yet close to airport. They had a patio and allowed you to cook your own food if you want. They were friendly to all the children. We were at a swim meet and the staff wished the children luck every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, no wireless internet in rooms”
Reviews.Author: sjhanlon
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times when I have an early morning flight out of Toronto Pearson Airport. Service has always been great and welcomed as a Marriott Platinum Guest every time. Rooms are a good size and clean. Unfortunately, I think this will be my last stay until they get wireless internet in the rooms. I always forget about this... if you have only an iPad or Laptop with no Ethernet forget about doing work in your room. For almost the same price I can stay at the Full Service Marriott where their is wireless internet and free parking for Platinum Members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel the night before a flight to New Orleans. Our package included leaving our car for up to 8 nights. The hotel is near many restaurants, but you will to drive to get to them. It's also only a few minute drive to Woodbine Racetrack and Slots. As we were checking in, a bunch of families were also checking in, and we saw lots of hockey gear - obviously a tournament was in town. I asked at reception if we could have a room away from the noise and we never heard a sound all night. Breakfast the next day was good and the shuttle to the airport was right on time. When we returned from our trip, a quick phone call to the hotel from the airport had the shuttle there in 10 minutes. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: Farrukh_fromLA
Reviews.Content: This a decent and clean place located near Toronto airport. They provide a shuttle from/to airport and hot breakfast of good quality. The staff is friendly, especially Ilhan who was very friendly and helpful. The only drawback is a small dining hall. It is hard to find an empty breakfast table if you come down say at 8:00- 8:30 so we had to wait 20 minutes with small kids to be seated. Basic capacity planning should have solved this problem. Anyway, overall ...not bad.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: countryjen
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto on business for about a month in February and March 2010. I stayed here for the entire duration of my stay. The hotel staff were very helpful and were most accomodating. The breakfasts were very good and included alot of variety. The grocery shopping service is quite helpful. The location was very convienent to where my meetings were taking place and the airport shuttle was very convienient but there wasn't very much within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKKF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel before and stay in Residence Inn's about monthly. I booked a one night using Marriott points and wanted to park at the hotel for a week. When I arrived I questioned if I would be better to pay for the room (instead of using points) to get a parking package. The front desk staff was kind and professional, assured me that it was fine to use the points and gave me a discount on parking. Later that evening the same staff member called our room to say that her supervisor would not allow the parking discount and they would charge us full rate. The difference was less that $30 so not worth making a big deal to this poor woman who had to call back but I was pretty disgusted that the supervisor would do this over $30. I found it very tacky and unprofessional!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at a Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: kimpete8
Reviews.Content: I've never been dissapointed at a Residence Inn, and almmost always try to stay at one when travelling on business. They're a little on the expensive side, so I rarely choose them when I'm paying the bill myself. The full kitchen is great, the room was in good shape and very clean, and the staff was very pleasant. The free hot breakfast was a nice surprise and very good. The lack of wireless internet was a little odd.

Reviews.Title: “Disintered staff, paperthin walls and bang crash thump all night”
Reviews.Author: munizaga
Reviews.Content: Checkin was ordinary â€“ only thing impressive about it was how the front desk staff trotted out the usual â€œWelcome to the residence inn blah blah blahâ€� in a disinterested monotone. When I made my booking I made a special requests asking for a room on the top floor which they hadnâ€™t done, asked again and this had no effect and they seems totally unconcerned. Mainly young kids who donâ€™t seem too interested in helping. It is a standard new residence inn and they are constructed with really cheap materials, paperthin walls and floors so you hear everything from the room above and on the sides â€“ I had big families above me and in the room next door - especially annoying was the room above â€“ it was bang, crash, thump all night. I asked to get moved twice and they said they couldnâ€™t do it, even offered to pay for a two bedroom but no luck. Then on the Friday I finished work at 5pm, arrived at the hotel at 5.10pm and noticed the carpark was empty so I thought now they will move me. Went to the front reception desk and asked if they could move me, and they said they could but would have to charge me for the room I was in and the new room as there was no one to clean my room â€“ by this stage I had enough and I told them to put me down for checkout tomorrow. There is a bit of traffic noise as on one side there is a major highway and other minor roads surrounding the hotel. Pool was nice, laundry room was fine $1.75 for a wash and $1.75 for the dryer. Nice and clean. Take away all the banging and thumping from the surrounding apartments and it would be acceptable but the noise and the attitude from the staff means I wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced for 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite”
Reviews.Author: LuvtoTravel19
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little before check in time and they were able to accommodate us which was welcome. The suite was large with king bed master suite, 2nd bedroom with bath, a full kitchen and livingroom area - 3 TVs. The carpets were showing signs of wear and stains. We were in a very quiet floor away from the elevator. I selected this hotel due to reviews and the price being less than half of price for one in downtown Toronto. The main drawback was that we pretty much had to drive everywhere - good thing for GPSs. We purchased a Toronto City pass and many of the attractions were not that close to downtown so I am not sure that public transportion would have been that reasonable for the 5 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for extended stays”
Reviews.Author: spike256
Reviews.Content: Friendly, effective service, spacious room, comfy bed. For the price of a motel, I got a separate bedroom, sitting room, and kitchen. No WiFi in the room, but the wired LAN worked well. Many restaurants nearby, but would need a car for groceries or mall runs. There were several frozen meals available at the front desk tuck shop, though. Courtesy shuttle from the airport was great, but you need to call first, which I think is standard. The in-hotel laundromat was handy, although the dryer didn't quite dry out my clothes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A true 'suite' hotel and excellent value at the airport”
Reviews.Author: doodlebug16
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we've found near the airport which offers a true "suite" -- a full kitchen with dishes and utensils and a bedroom separate from the roomy living area. When we need to stay near the airport this is our hotel of choice. i would say its many amenities /advantages are more apparent during a multi-day stay than during a one-night stay. It is spacious, clean, quiet and efficient, with friendly service and an excellent free breakfast buffet (including healthy options). Parking is also free whereas other airport hotels charge $8, $12 or more, per night. . It would be nice to have covered front and back entrances where bags could be unloaded with protection from inclement weather. That's about the only shortfall we noticed. This is not a luxury, boutique or honeymoon hotel. It's clean, comfortable, well-run, well-appointed, with friendly staff and great amenities at an excellent price. Good choice for businessmen and families who are staying near the airport for a few days. The hotel grounds and immediate environs are not interesting or attractive, but they are clean, tidy, safe, quiet and within walking distance of some chain restaurants. The photos taken by one of the reviewers don't look anything like the room we stayed in during Fall 2009. Our King suite was nicely furnished, with contemporary furniture in very good condition, good quality bed linens, comfortable bed and lots of good towels. Pots and pans were clean and sturdy. A good supply of dishes, glasses and cutlery, and a dishwasher. Lots of hot water, everything in good running order. We had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngsbungalow
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for the last night of our 2 week tour of eastern Canada, we wanted somewhere close to the airport to chill out in following all the sightseeing. The check in was very efficient and the receptionist was really friendly. I had requested a room close to the lifts and extra feather pillows. I got exactly what I asked for we couldn't have been closer to the silent lifts. The size of the room was amazing, a fully fitted kitchen, lounge area, bedroom with luxuriously comfortable king size bed, a changing room with wash bowl / vanity unit leading to the bath /shower room. Everything was modern and spotlessly clean with a TV and free wifi. We made full use of the indoor pool and jacuzzi and the free hot breakfast was plentiful and very fresh. Although we arrived late in the evening there was a choice of places to eat within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The free shuttle to the airport took lass than 10 minutes. Should we return to Toronto we would certainly use this hotel again and highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay another night!”
Reviews.Author: hilbill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was attending a conference at the Sheraton and overflow registrants were put at the Residence Inn. The hotel was very clean (and I'm fussy!) and the staff helpful. I did not have the continental breakfast as I was eating at the Sheraton with colleagues at the conference. But, in speaking with others I was lucky to be at the Residence Inn as the rooms are suites and much larger than a regular room. The cost was $145.00 which I'm sure my group got as a special rate and can't imagine the regular price. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was acceptable, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Homer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in late February, room 146. The cab ride from the airport was $18 which seemed a little stiff to get here. The check-in was quick and efficient though it should be at 1230 in the morning. The room was clean and had a full kitchen, though the counter tops and appliances seemed a little old. There was a two person table and chairs for meals and a sofa with coffee table and end tables in the living room with the tv. The bedroom had a king bed and a tv with the bathroom as an ensuite. The sink was outside of the toilet and shower area. The shower had some mildew and seemed on the older side. I couldn't control the heat in the room so it was very warm to sleep. The bed was reasonably comfortable. Breakfast in the morning is included and was fairly extensive. The dining room is a little on the small side so you have to be early if you want a table. There are no cabs that wait out front for you so you will have to arrange for one in advance or call for one at the time and wait. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room, basically checkin, sleep, and check out. Would probably stay here in the future if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice for the airport area”
Reviews.Author: SueKA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here picking up spouse at the airport. The staff is very nice and professional, room was clean and spacious, and has a kitchen with cooktop, microwave, fridge and is equipped. There are 2 TVs and plenty of channels. There's a free hot breakfast in the morning,and most weekdays there's an evening social event in the same room. The night I was there it was chicken stir fry night, and the night before was Mexican night. We enjoyed the pool and whirlpool. Another bonus, parking is free, which is unusual. There's a free shuttle which needs to be reserved in advance, and you'll need to call for it from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was almost too short for a fair review--but it met our needs!”
Reviews.Author: lligett
Reviews.Content: We did the Sleep, Park, & Fly option here as we had a fairly early flight out of Toronto, and we live an hour (or more with traffic) from the airport. We've learned the hard way not to take chances with that drive, especially in the winter! Anyway, we didn't get in until about 9 pm and left the next morning at 6:40, so I don't have a lot to review here. I can tell you the following: -the rooms are clean and spacious. We've stayed at the Residence Inn in downtown Toronto as well, and the room layout was very similar. It would probably be ideal for a longer stay, since you have the kitchenette and "living room" area separate from the bedroom. -Breakfast on the weekend doesn't start until 7, so we asked if there was a way to get some breakfast to go. They don't offer anything (I know many hotels do "to go bags" with muffins, yogurt, fruit--something like that), but we were told that they started setting up breakfast early so we could just take whatever was out. Unfortunately, there wasn't much out yet at 6:30, so we just had coffee and ate some food that I'd packed just in case. -The airport shuttle seems to run on a set schedule, every 30 minutes (10 and 40 past the hour). It does stop at one other hotel on the way to the airport. I got nervous when we did that, because we were already a few minutes later than I wanted to be, but it was a quick stop and then we were at the airport right away. Terminal 3 was the shuttle's first stop for us, so if you're going to Terminal 1 you may want to allow a few more minutes. -We were able to park our car right beside the hotel, so I felt it was really safe. And when we came home, our car was just fine--I know that can be a worry with some airport park & fly hotel deals, so I thought it was worth mentioning. -To get the shuttle back from the airport, apparently you are supposed to use a courtesy phone in the terminal. In terminal 3 we never saw these phones (we heard later that they were at the opposite end of the terminal from the shuttle pick up point. Obviously that's not the hotel's fault, it's the airport's!), so when we got out to the pick up point we say the sign that said call for pick up and just called from our cell. The operator didn't give us any specific information about how long it would be, but said they were sending the shuttle for us, so we assumed it wouldn't be long. It was about 30 minutes before the shuttle turned up! However, it turned out that the driver had been told by the dispatcher that we were at terminal 1, so he had been sitting there for a LONG time before he called back in and they gave him the correct information. I felt bad for him, and even worse for the other couple who had apparently been stuck sitting on the shuttle all that time while he waited for us. I'm guessing this is an aberration and that normally pick-up would be pretty prompt. All in all, we would probably stay here again on a future early morning flight. I will look at some of the other options, and will probably read the breakfast times everywhere closely--it would be nice to eat before heading to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Passing Through”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
Reviews.Content: This hotel really met my needs. I was passing through Toronto meeting up with family before heading to Europe on vacation. We got a 2 bedroom, which had a pull out bed in the living room. It was just what we needed. The pool and hot tub are nice, and there was even a tennis court with a basketball net that was great for my nephews and niece. There are also complimentary computers for internet access near the lobby. If you are looking to visit Toronto, this hotel is a bit far from areas of interest. It is close to the airport, offers a complimentary shuttle and parking is free. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. In fact, we liked it so much we booked there again for our return two weeks later.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ulstergirl67
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at this hotel. It was wonderful. The room was large, clean, equipped with a kitchen. We had a very comfortable King size bed and a pull out couch. The staff was friendly, especially the lady working the continental breakfast. There was a small indoor pool and hot tub. There were plenty of towels available and it was not overly busy. It was quiet and we were able to get a good night's sleep as my daughter was participating in a swim meet that weekend. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for YYZ Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust-For-2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for an overnight...catching an early a.m.flight to the US. Prompt and pleasant registration...good rate... Very quiet rooms...did not hear a peep from adjacent highways and major airport at all!! Comfortable bedding. Complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. Full Complimentary breakfast in the a.m. Your choice...waffles,oatmeal, fruit, cereal, eggs, yogurt, sausage, toast, coffee, tea juice...etc... Terrific Absolutely great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: AWTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a weekend for leisure after a week in a Marriott in Brampton for work. I can't find much fault with this hotel especially at $87/night - and that's not a special rate either. Convenient if you want to stay near the airport. Restaurants are walking distance. It's off Dixon Road so road noise isn't an issue. The suite was clean and large - the living area could use some updating but the bedroom was in better condition. The hotel isn't going to set a new standard for you, but I highly doubt if it'll disappoint. The only negative was the breakfast which can get crazy busy if you wait until 9 a.m. I had to bring my food up to the room to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: KikiTee
Reviews.Content: Okay, so there were good and bad things about this hotel. The GOOD. -staff was fantastic, from the cleaning ladies and maintenance guys up, everyone really went out of their way to make sure everything was okay. -other guests, we met more than a few people at the hotel and everyone was very friendly, sometimes at the 'higher end' hotels people can be really snotty. -the cleanliness. I don't think I saw a speck of dirt. And believe me, I look! Corners of ceilings in the lobby to the claw feet on the tables in the hall, no dust. Pretty impressive. The BAD. -the room is smaller than you think it will be, it was adequate, but not what I expected. -the sofabed...oh....my. Seriously, if you love the people you travel with, you won't expect them to sleep on this hammock. We padded it with the (hideous) coverlet and 3 blankets. Didn't really help. Also, the sheets they provide for it are see through. -the blankets. Before we realized that we'd need a blanket to pad the bed, we thought we'd need it to sleep. Still not sure if they were made of velcro or sandpaper. Had to go down and ask for the same blanket (duvet) that they put on the beds. Luckily, I've already made my comment about great staff. -pillows and bed. How did they raise the floor like that? Very hard. Hard pillows? Yes, both the feather and the foam. The hotel has a VERY dated feel to it. It reminds me of the 70's, when you'd travel with the whole family. There's even a barbecue outside! The pool is bromine, which is kind of a salt/chlorine combo, it's okay, but pretty drying on the skin. I expected the pool area to be full of kids, but it wasn't bad at all. The gym is quite nicely equipped, pretty much all you need. A wired free connection in the room for the laptop was really nice. Driving distance to shopping/grocery. The tuck shop (snacks and drinks) had a really nice selection that wasn't wildly overpriced like minibars can be. All in all, I wouldn't stay there again unless I got a fantastic deal like I did this time. The space wasn't worth it as I prefer more sophisticated hotels. I wasn't left with a bad impression, not at all, but the hotel itself wasn't memorable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: toronto6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen bedroom suite with a separate kitchenette and living room area. The rooms were nice (pull out sofa looked a bit old), kitchen had all the necessary cooking utensils. The shower tub could have been cleaner, but that was not a very big deal. The thing that bothered me the most is upon check-out, the lady at the front desk asked me if I made two phone calls to a 416 number that morning. I told her that I made one phone call, not two. And then she looked at me skeptically, and said: okay, well we will charge you for one then, its $1. I was confused, asked her if they charged for local phone calls. She said they did, and its a dollar/phone call. So I told her, no where in the hotel or anything does it state that you charge for phone calls, and she didn't even have a good answer for me. All she said is that: well we do charge for local and long distance. Long distance is obvious, and thats exactly what I told her. I don't expect a hotel to not charge for long distance, but when they charge for local, should they not let people know?! Then, the front desk lady continued to say that if they didn't charge, they would have let us know upon check in. First of all, all the hotels I stayed in previously did NOT charge for local phone calls, and even if some do (maybe I just didn't stay in those before), they should let people know and not just let them assume things. Thank god I didn't make more phone calls than that. $1 was not a big deal, its the fact that they never mention it nor apologize for not mentioning it. And a word about internet, it is pretty slow. No wireless internet either, only wired.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: travelmamaOntario
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean. King-sized bed in 1 bedroom was very comfy. However, pull out not so much! The kitchen was very nice, large bathroom with vanity outside. Pool small, but clean, indoors and warm. Breakfast was free- Hot and cold items. Great selection, well-stocked, sufficient seating and very good!! Easy to get around. Many restaurants nearby. The Woodbine Mall with the fantasy fair(rides) inside was nearby and very enjoyable. Go on a Sunday at 11am before stores open for the amusement rides- quiet and no lines. Would stay again. Great value. Close to attractions if you drive.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingbugBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Caribana weekend and we though the place was just perfect! First, let me say that we chose the hotels based on the previous favorable reviews and the fact that the hotel is just 20 minutes from Downtown Toronto - we were not disappointed. Check-in was a breeze and we received our Free parking pass at the same time. I must say that the Front Desk staff were very professional and courteous at all times - and really extended themselves to us. Our room which was a one bedroom suite was just the right size and had great amenities -microwave, fridge, stove top (electric) and dishwasher (who could ask for more).There is also a separate desk where you can connect to their Free high speed internet, so bring the laptop along. If not, there are 2 computers downstairs which you can use. The computers are right next to the pool and exercise room and yes, the hotels pictures are pretty accurate - they are on the small side, but it worked just fine for us. The Free breakfast is an added plus and was actually quite filling - a word to the wise - go early, since it can get a bit crowded the later it gets. Overall our stay was just great and if we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTyson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! all staff are wonderful and helpful. They are always willing to help and go out of their way to make your stay a home away from home. I recommend this hotel to anyone anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle Stolen from Residence Inn Toronto Airport!!”
Reviews.Author: Looieb
Reviews.Content: Recently, my husband & I stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Airport. As part of their Stop-over package, we could leave our car at the hotel, until we returned from our vacation. During the week we were away, our car was stolen from the hotel's parking lot. It was quite a shock to realize that our car was missing. The apathy of the hotel was very disappointing. They made it very clear that this was NOT their problem. My husband had been concientious to park the car under a light, and yet still it was stolen. As there is no outside surveilance, the hotel again accepted NO LIABILITY. We were told that, perhaps on a future visit, they might be able to offer us a lower rate. All in all, a very frustrating experience. We will never again make the mistake to utilize Residence Inn as a stop-over hotel. A very expensive lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night after coming home from a trip. The hotel staff were very friendly and went out of there way to make sure you were happy. The rooms were a good size and everything was very clean. We used the high speed internet and had no issues at all with it, it was nice and speedy and very easy to connect up. The breakfast in the morning also good, they had a very good variety available. We would stay at this hotel again without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with Children!”
Reviews.Author: cozzyMitchell
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Residence Inn for a girls hockey tournament. Normally three nights in a basic hotel room with 2 Adults, 2 Kids, 2 Sets of Hockey Equipment etc. is crammed and not very pleasant. The rooms at the Residence were like mini apartments! There was a full kitchen, a living room with pull out sofa bed, and a separate bedroom (with a door that shuts which is great for privacy) and the bathroom off of the bedroom. On Thursday evening they had a free supper which on that night was soup and salads, but the menu shows chili, shepherds pie etc. It was really good. The continental breakfast is a hot breakfast which is also very good. Housekeeping came in every morning and filled the dishwasher, ran it and then emptied it the next day --- awesome! Upon getting home from our trip I realized I had left my reading glasses on the desk. I called housekeeping and they did find them and Fedex'd them to me within two days --- Thank Goodness! Overall a great stay and definately will look for Residence Inn whereever we travel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Toronto near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in a 1 br suite when we went to Medieval Times. We enjoyed the location and the facilities. Our room had a small kitchen and dishwasher. Bed and Sofa bed was comfortable for our girls. The pool and the hot tub were very enjoyable. Breakfast in the morning was good and convenient. Staff was great and helpful. Would return to this hotel every time in Toronto, attending consumer shows at the International center or when departing on trip from Toronto Pearson Airport. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “downtown alternative”
Reviews.Author: maristgrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Residence Inn near the Toronto airport for a long weekend. We were in Toronto to see the Red Sox play the Blue Jays. Our schedule kept changing so by the time we could commit to our trip there were no decent rates available at any of the downtown hotels. The Residence Inn was clean and comfortable. There are many restaurant choices nearby, but the nearest grocery store is a few miles away. The drive to Toronto took about 30 minutes, from leaving the hotel parking lot to finding a parking lot/spot in downtown. On the second day, we drove about 15 minutes to a subway stop and took the train into the city. It's free on the weekends and was clean and safe. While everything went fine, if we return to Toronto I would prefer to stay in downtown for the convenience. If you want to rest, get rid of bags, change clothes, etc., it's difficult when your hotel is far away from places you want to see. We enjoyed the baseball games and would highly recommend visiting the Hockey Hall of Fame in downtown. Also, absolutely take time to stop in Niagara Falls to see the falls.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: jmartibOswego_NY
Reviews.Content: I believe in giving credit when credit is due and this hotel deserves alot. Went to Toronto to celebrate our 33rd anniversary and for theater downtown. Unlike years ago, hotel prices in the city are outrageous and deals can't be found. Previous reviews for this hotel have been great and this was enough for us. All services by hotel staff were done with a smile everytime. Check-in was a pleasure and the separate 1 bedroom room was superb. Every dish, glass and utensil was clean and waiting for use. The swimming pool was neither hot nor cold. Just cool enough to be refreshing. The whirlpool was plently warm enough. Several restaurants including Montana's Bar and Grill, Tony Roma's, Tucker's MarketPlace and Boston Pizza are across from the hotel and there is no need to drive. We ate at Ton'y Roma's and with the tip spent $80. There are no cheap places to eat. The drive to downtown is about 18 miles if going via the 401 then down Yonge Street. A better choice might be the TTC from the Yorkdale Mall. Cost is $2.25 per person each way if you buy at least 10 tokens at the mall entrance to the train. Parking at the mall is free and safe. Entire area is patrolled by security. We were out until 11:30 pm at there was still plenty of activity in the area. Always felt safe and the parking garage is brightly lit. Be sure and research the drive to and from the hotel as the traffic in Toronto is unbeliveable. This hotel and it's staff exceeded our expectations and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: A380-900
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2BR suite with fireplace which was very clean with the usual Residence Inn standard. Staff was very friendly even at very late arrival in a fully booked hotel. Breakfast was extremely crowded but staff kept a good pace to refill. Just one staff member told a guest at 9.57am that tortillas will not be refilled as it's already 10am. After the guests complaint, fresh tortillas arrived. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: cabinman
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a 2 bedroom suite at this airport hotel and I was a little leery due to some of the negative reviews, but when we walked into our suite everyone went ...hmm nice... The fully equiped kitchen had granite countertops and ceramic tile floors as did the 2 bathroms in our suite. The beds were very comfortable and with 3 tvs in the suite we all watched what we wanted in complete comfort. At $230 per night for this luxury suite along with a hot breakfast made this a great value. The service was very sincere and friendly and we really could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but trying”
Reviews.Author: medicengland
Reviews.Content: Well check in was fast and pleasant. Room clean and tidy even though there were old tissues from the last guest by the bed. Forget the bath a couple of ounces of water and its full, but good shower with lots of hot water. If some one runs a tap in an other room of flush the loo you guessed it you can hear it. Make sure you pack those â€œear plugsâ€� you will need them in your room. Aircon has to be turned off at night far to loud. Pillows rock hard or flat. Towels in bathroom more like hand towels than bath towels. The room was never dusted or the carpet vacuumed as the dust grew day by day. Breakfast was small by good for what is was. No changing rooms in the pool area. Spa bath is really hot water with 4 jets and lots of chemicals pool was fine, but they ask you to shower but the 3 soap dispensers were empty for the whole time I was there. The views out the hotel windows are of nothing! For the price and a place to put ones head ok but I would suggest you look some where else for a quiet hotel with views but if you can put up with hearing others around you for the price you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: SteveOv
Reviews.Content: Just had a romantic night with my wife (who else?) and thought this hotel was very good. Was hoping to go downtown but looking at $275 or more for anything good. For $129 + tax we got - huge 1 bedroom unit with separate living/kitchen area, great Kingsize bed w tons of pillows (w pullout sofa bed, you could manage w 2 additional people if you really wanted a value stay but pay the whopping 129 and enjoy). - well equipped kitchen, modern everything - 2 TVs, both modern - corridor bathroom sink/closet and full bathroom - full hot buffet brkft that had lots of choice and hot, unlike many buffets. - free parking, free Internet access - nice pool, hottub, and well-maintained weight room (there is also a mini-basketball court outside) - quality throughout room as in fixtures, kitchen counters, applicances, tables, etc. No restaurant on-site (ergo the name residence inn and kitchens and grocery room-delivery - wow), but lots of restaurants and other hotel restaurants around. We chose, based on Internet reviews, to eat at Renaissance hotel 2 blocks away, which was pricy (surprise, surprise) but very pretty and v gd food. The only negative was one of the two TV remotes was bad but they had it fixed within 1 hour. Only overall disappointment is the lack of live music/dancing at the airport hotels, a lost art perhaps? This area could really do well on value by offering more entertainment and thereby offer a "half-price" experience that competes with downtown Toronto. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Area”
Reviews.Author: Redstonebob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many airport area hotels in the past several years . The Residence Inn provided us with the best value by far when one packages together the room type, staff, free evening snacks and following day breakfast, service, etc. It will be our choice every time we need near airport accomodation. Bob and Mary Peterborough, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mouse68
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was rated #2 on Tripadvisor and it had free parking. The room was amazing and very clean. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel and ask for Amanda when you visit.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: Brad_Lazorka
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel with comfortable rooms with upgraded amenities. The super location and friendly staff are a bonus considering the excellent rates at this hotel. First on the list to stay in Toronto for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Nicely Priced”
Reviews.Author: martyfarty69
Reviews.Content: Me and My Wife stayed in this Hotel Recently as it was the top available choice for the weekend we wanted to stay ( The #1 was the Residence Inn Downtown, but was booked up because of the Toronto Film Festival going on the same weekend ) We arrived late and the staff were very helpful and check in was very smooth and painless, the Room was a 4th floor room and was a nice size and very clean, the layout was very user friendly and the kitchenette was a nice size, we would see planes landing all the time outside our room but you could barely hear them thanks to the excellent soundproofing. Parking was Free which was a nice bonus and the drive to the nearest Subway Station was only about 10 mins away, Toronto has an excellent Public Transport System so leaving the Car behind was a viable option and parking was never a concern for us. The free high speed internet in the room was also a breeze to use and very very fast, and to top it off the Breakfast in the mornings was tasty and plentiful. I would stay in this hotel again in a Heartbeat and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “One word - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: traveller_654321
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. Great, friendly staff who go beyond call of duty to help. Very clean rooms, good amenities and nearby good places to eat, free shuttle...

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: jvsGrandCayman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Airport 29-31 Aug in a 2 bedroom suite. With four children this was a great deal as included full breakfast each morning and evening reception Monday to Thursdays (5:00 to 7:30). Children loved to make own waffles. We arrived on Wednesday which was a bar-b-que night but unfortunately did not return from shopping in time to partake. Thursday night was chicken stirfry with rice which we all enjoyed. The bedrooms are a bit smaller than we were used to but adequate. Two bathrooms and three tv's were, of course, a great convenience with four teenagers. Only drawback - in checking in I asked if we could have a rollaway bed as with three girls 12, 16 and 18 they did not want to share sofa bed with older brother. However, front desk said rollaway bed was not allowed in room with sofa bed. We solved the situation with going out to Walmart and buying a aerobed with pump for $29. Would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay would recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: kkjjandrews
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Toronto Airport Residence inn and are very happy. We picked this location to be half way to downtown and half way to cananda's wonderland . Very happy with the reservation desk asking if we would like an Early check-in!! this was very helpful we were able to check-in at 11:00 am . They called once we got to our room to see if everything was to our liking. We booked a 2 bedroom suite it was very CLEAN and well furnished the 2 bathrooms are perfect for a family of 4 much easier for showers and getting ready to go. Nice tvs in room 3 total. Excellent hot breakfeast included with room eggs, french toast ,bagels, home fries, fresh fruit , juice, yogert ,muffins , cereal and much more. we brought it up to our room and ate in our kitchen. Fireplace in room was nice addition. Bathrooms are marble with very lovely faucets. Large enough to be very comfortable. Beds were furnished with down conforters very comfortable. The pool and hot tub were very clean and not crowded. Hot tub was perfect temp. Can't say enough for this location. Also we asked for late check out which was no problem..This hotel is not fancy and frilly it is just what you need to be happy and comfortable, and not feel they took you to the cleaners. our 2 night stay was $497.00 canadian and worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: makerofking
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel for the price. Booked a 2 Bedroom Suite for 3 nights. Comfortable rooms. Very good housekeeping. Very great hot breakfast. Perfect Hotel for family with kids. High Speed Wired and Wireless Internet did not work in my room. Was given a discount for the same. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: GuyaneseMadness
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while attending a function that was in the area. Upon arrival I was a little dissappointed in the staff while checking in. They were almost 'rude' so to speak, as if they didn't want us there. After that was all over with, we went up to our two bedroom suite which was quite spacious. It had a full kitchen and two bathrooms as well. Overall, I thought it was a decent stay for a decent price. There wasn't anything about the hotel that was exceptional, but I wasn't in it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterjervis
Reviews.Content: Marriot Residence hotels are an excellent idea. Each comes with a fully fitted kitchen, stove, microwave, fridge, all the utensils, etc. This is very useful!! Bedroom and lounge areas are separated, each having their own tv. Good location in Mississauga but you will need a car! Toronto 20 mins away, Niagara an hour. Hotel has complimentary computer access in all rooms and a pc in the lobby for use by guests Breakfast complimentary. Very clean and seems quite new. Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: luv2sitec
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked our stay from 7/16-7/22 at a AAA rate of $209 for a two bedroom suite-we were excited knowing that the reviews were positive. Upon our arrival we told the front desk that we would be leaving 2 days earlier than originally booked and were then told that our room rate would increase an add'l $20/night-much to our surprise -we thought we had a confirmed rate of $209 per night so be aware of this rate fluctuation. Our 2 bedroom suite was spotless and in very good condition and although we requested a high floor we ended up on the 3rd floor-there was too much traffic noise so upon our request we were moved to the 5th floor-there was no availability on the higher floors. There is one community computer for use by hotel patrons but a good majority of the time it is occupied by children...understandable. The pool is okay and the jacuzzi warm but in need of stronger jets to get that therapuetic affect. The breakfast buffet was great-many hot items to choose from and always well stocked no matter what time of the morning it was. The staff that worked the buffet were wonderful-pleasant and helpful. We did not try the evening reception so I cannot comment on that. Beside the disappointment of the rate fluctuation I have two other issues with the hotel. The first being that it is in the middle of a business park and there is NOTHING around for entertainment save for the adults -only place that I'm sure many businessmen frequent while there. The hotel itself did not even have pay TV so my children couldn't even watch a pay movie if they had wanted to. The nearest movie theater was a 25 minute drive through some not so nice sections of Toronto. So we basically felt like we had to stay out really late as there was nothing to do once we got back except for swimming or trying to use the mini basketball court that was always in use. My other issue is that restaurant selection in the area ,was very poor...there is a Montanas, Marketplace, Boston Pizza, Tony Romas and Outback by the business park and everything else was fast food....it was amazing-we ended up at Boston Pizza twice and on the second night my 13 yr old commented that her Ravioli bake tasted just like canned Chef Boyardee and she was completely correct! This is just my opinion-I was very excited to go and then disappointed after we had gotten there-It is so far away from anything dowtown!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel.... My wife and I stayed here on a great weekend rate while visiting Toronto. The staff was extremely friendly and were great at recommending attractions and providing detailed travel directions into the downtown areas. The room (actually two rooms - living area and a separate bedroom) was huge and the bed was very comfortable. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cebrianent
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights with our two children, ages 8 and 10, at the hotel. The room was spacious and clean with a nice kitchen and separate bedroom and pull out couch for the children. The staff was pleasant and very informative about local attractions. Breakfast had a wide variety of food. It's a great hotel for a family vacation.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Reading Court, Toronto, Ontario M9W7K7, Canada
